description: Change of Use of the ground floor and part basement level from its current permitted use for operations within the B1 (office) use class and 81 square metres of A1 (retail) floor space to use of 2492 square metres of the floor space for a Sui Generis use as a conference centre and Masonic meeting venue to include or permit use for training, presentations, product launches, fashion shows, antique and collectors fairs, weddings, bar mitzvahs, funerals, receptions, private parties, the provision of music, dance, entertainment, bar and lounge area; and 595sqm of floor space for flexible B1(office)/A1(retail)/ A2 (financial and professional services)/ A3 (cafe and restaurant) /D1 (non residential institutions)/ D2 (assembly and leisure) use.
decision_conditions: REASON : The proposal results in the loss of class B1 office accommodation suitable for occupation by small and medium sized enterprises from the Central Activities Zone, where such provision is of strategic economic importance.  The proposed change of use is considered contrary to policy E4 (Loss of Business Use) and E13 (Protection of Premises for Small Firms and Opportunities for Business Start-Ups) of the Islington Unitary Development Plan 2002, policies CS7 (Bunhill and Clerkenwell) and CS13 (Employment Spaces) of the Islington Core Strategy 2011, policies 2.10 (Central Activities Zone - Strategic Priorities), 2.11 (Central Activities Zone - Strategic Functions), 2.13 (Opportunity Areas and Intensification Areas), 4.1 (Development London's Economy) and 4.2 (Offices) of the London Plan 2011, emerging policies DM31 (Loss of Existing Business Floorspace) of the Development Management Policies (Submission Document) June 2012, emerging policies BC1(King Square and St Luke's) and BC8 (Achieving a balanced mix of uses) Finsbury Local Plan (Submission Document) June 2012.
